other_tests.findings: Discontinuous areas of ulcerated and bleeding mucosa, with friable mucosa in the rectum and cecum; the ileocecal valve was too ulcerated to be entered. Biopsy revealed an ulcer with a focal giant-cell reaction.
Esophagus, stomach, duodenal bulb, and second portion of the duodenum were normal. Biopsy specimens were normal.

other_tests.procedure_name: Upper gastrointestinal series with small-bowel follow-through
other_tests.findings: Several massively dilated loops of distal small bowel with intervening areas of stricture.

other_tests.date: Six weeks before admission and one week before admission
other_tests.findings: Extensive inflammatory changes in the right lower abdominal quadrant and abnormal enhancement of the cecal wall and ascending colon; numerous dilated loops of distal small bowel.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Changes nearly identical to those seen on the previous scan, as well as a small amount of intraperitoneal fluid in the pelvis.

other_tests.findings: Marked thickening, creeping fat, and subserosal studding in the terminal ileum; marked dilation with a stricture proximal to ileocecal valve; presence of granulomas.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Identified multiple well-formed epithelioid granulomas corresponding to earlier endoscopic findings.

other_tests.findings: Multiple well-formed epithelioid granulomas and areas of necrosis.
